timeline.bodyText: Define and throw a dedicated exception instead of using a generic one.
timeline.author: codeclimate

timeline.bodyText: Return an empty collection instead of null.
timeline.author: codeclimate

timeline.bodyText: Method createJob has 6 arguments (exceeds 4 allowed). Consider refactoring.
timeline.author: codeclimate
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -21,9 +22,16 @@

      * @param mbis          - The list of MBIs of patients to fetch data for

+    UUID createJob(UUID orgID,

timeline.bodyText: Method createJob has 6 arguments (exceeds 4 allowed). Consider refactoring.
timeline.author: codeclimate

replies.bodyText: Not fixing this issue because alternatives like a builder pattern add more complexity. Personally, I feel the 4 parameter limit is too tight.
replies.author: RickHawesUSDS

timeline.bodyText: This reduces the level of noise in the aggregator logs.
timeline.author: RickHawesUSDS

replies.bodyText: LGTM, as we're only changing this for our local config.
replies.author: ronaldheft-usds

timeline.bodyText: Style change. null is redundant.
timeline.author: RickHawesUSDS

timeline.bodyText: since and transactionTime are new.
timeline.author: RickHawesUSDS

timeline.bodyText: requestPatientFromServer now does a search for so we can pass lastUpdated
timeline.author: RickHawesUSDS

timeline.bodyText: This change is kind of subtle. When lastUpdated is specified an empty bundle does not mean that the beneId doesn't exist, rather it may mean that a resource didn't match the lastUpdated parameter.
timeline.author: RickHawesUSDS

timeline.bodyText: Nitpick here, but would it make sense to simply pass the optional value, rather than a null?
timeline.author: nickrobison-usds

timeline.bodyText: This error message isn't very clear to me, what's it signaling?
timeline.author: nickrobison-usds

timeline.bodyText: Probably a stylistic change, but given this ternary spreads across multiple lines, maybe it makes sense to split this into an if/else statement.
timeline.author: nickrobison-usds

timeline.bodyText: Do we want VSCode settings in the repo?
timeline.author: em1

timeline.bodyText: It's not clear to me why this changed. We don't need to check the resource type anymore?
timeline.author: em1

replies.bodyText: Good question. Every job, including those ** without** a since parameter, is now time-bound by the transaction time. This is done for correctness. So every request to the BFD is now a search with a lastUpdated set. This change has the happy side-effect of making the getPatientFromServer API have the same signature as the Coverage and EOB methods. So, the special case if statements are no longer needed.
replies.author: RickHawesUSDS

timeline.author: em1

replies.bodyText: This text is actually from a version of the FHIR spec. I'm replacing it with the current version which is more precise. Also, the real change I needed to do was move from String to a InstantDt
replies.author: RickHawesUSDS

timeline.bodyText: Method createEmptyBatch has 6 arguments (exceeds 4 allowed). Consider refactoring.
timeline.author: codeclimate

timeline.message:
Code Review Fixes

- Removed vscode settings
- OpenApi wording matching the lastest FHIR spec
- Clearer logic in job creation
- Better wording for the BFD regression error case

timeline.bodyText: In a recent commit we switched from passing in the environment variables directly and are using an envfile instead. We should follow the same pattern for the API service as we do the aggregator service.
timeline.author: ronaldheft-usds

timeline.bodyText: This was pulled out into it's own PR now, so I suspect this change will go away once rebased with master.
timeline.author: ronaldheft-usds
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -75,4 +75,15 @@
         </addColumn>
     </changeSet>
 
+    <changeSet id="since-support" author="rickhawesusds">

timeline.bodyText: Nice usage of @Named, but I'm wondering if this is going to get confusing. Thoughts if it would make sense to make an interface extension IGenericBBClient and IGenericAttributionClient so the code is cleaner and we don't accidentally import the incorrect client?
timeline.author: ronaldheft-usds

replies.bodyText: I see the advantage of your suggestion. However, that is a big change affecting many files. I suggest that I do this change in a follow-on PR.
replies.author: RickHawesUSDS

timeline.bodyText: Looks great!
timeline.author: ronaldheft-usds

timeline.bodyText: Good call on reusing/renaming this!
timeline.author: em1

timeline.message:
_since Support

- Added since and transactionTime to the JobBatch
- BBClient requestPatientFromServer returns Bundles and supports lastUpdated.
- Code climate fixes
- BlueBluttonClient support requestPatientFromServerByMbiHash
- Handle where bundle is empty when _since is used
- Fetch transacationTime from the BFD
- BFD client called at the submit of the job
- Also serves as a healthcheck
- patient test resources are Bundles

Adding BB2 client in DPC-API

- Named provides because of two FHIR clients
- bbclient confs
- POM

Added submit and complete extensions to the JobCompleteModel

- Set up mock client transaction time

Improve tests

- Add lastUpdated to test data
- MockClient implements lastUpdated
- Tests use lastUpdated

Code Review Fixes

- Removed vscode settings
- OpenApi wording matching the lastest FHIR spec
- Clearer logic in job creation
- Better wording for the BFD regression error case

Rebase changes

- Converted new tests to new createJob signature
- Passing of env variable
